image.altText: A render of the proposed Macquarie Point stadium, showing a wood-panelled round structure

props.synopsis: Special legislation to fast-track the approval process for Hobart's proposed AFL stadium could be overtaken by the original Project of State Significance process, as the snap election interrupts voting timelines.

title.children: Delay on Hobart stadium reopens door for planning commission process

image.altText: Wide shot of the bow of the electric ferry in the shipyard

props.synopsis: Two Tasmanian-built electric Incat ferries have been commissioned for one of Europe's busiest ferry routes. It follow's the launch of the world's largest electric vehicle in May, which was also built by Incat.

title.children: Tasmanian electric ferry builder Incat plans to double in size amid Danish ship order

image.altText: An old man with a mask and scarf, two young women and another gentlemen with a face covering walk into a court building.

props.synopsis: A former Hobart teacher and theatre director has pleaded not guilty to 14 charges including rape, indecent assault and the persistent abuse of a child. Keith Bates-Willie is accused of indecently touching numerous students over a 25-year period.

title.children: Former Hobart teacher stands trial charged with child sexual abuse

image.altText: Man in suit walks, clapping hands, followed by family, surrounded by crowd and media

props.synopsis: After four elections in seven years, calls are mounting for fixed four-year terms to be introduced in the Tasmanian parliament. But not everyone believes it would resolve the state's political instability.

title.children: Voters are frustrated by early elections. Would fixed terms work in Tasmania?

image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff speaks while standing behind a lectern

props.synopsis: As Jeremy Rockliff continues his pursuit of engineering a minority Liberal government after the weekend's Tasmanian election, the ABC calls a 10th seat for Labor.

title.children: 'Stability' offered to independents, as Labor picks up another seat

image.altText: a couple with their back to the camera

props.synopsis: A couple visiting Tasmania for the first time has told of being pulled to the ground and punched by teens while walking home from dinner in Hobart.

title.children: 'We didn't know them': Tourists tell story after assault in Hobart CBD

image.altText: An elderly couple standing in front of an old house which is undergoing minor construction.

props.synopsis: Moved by stories of homelessness, a Tasmanian couple has taken it upon themselves to offer a solution to the state's housing crisis.

title.children: Philanthropic couple buy Hobart property as social housing for older women

image.altText: An emaciated teenage boy lying in a hospital bed with his mother by his side.

props.synopsis: In a ward of Gaza City's Shifa Hospital, multiple children and some adults can be found emaciated from the lack of food. Doctors say the rate of death from starvation is rapidly rising.

title.children: Weighing just 10kg at 14 years old: 'Major starvation' takes hold in Gaza

image.altText: A close up of a smiling Matthew Perry, wearing clear plastic-rimmed glasses, a black suit jacked and a grey v-neck shirt.

props.synopsis: Dr Salvador Plasencia is charged with four counts of illegal distribution of the drug ketamine.

title.children: Doctor pleads guilty to supplying ketamine to Matthew Perry

image.altText: Emmanuel Macron and his wife Brigitte

props.synopsis: Candace Owens, a right-wing American podcaster, has repeatedly claimed the French president's wife used to be a man.

title.children: French president sues US influencer over claims his wife was born a man

image.altText: A child sits on a wall with a bike nearby

props.synopsis: A new report from Victoria Legal Aid reveals a rise in the number of children being placed on violence intervention orders, with some as young as 10 years old.

title.children: 'How does this help?': Families fight intervention orders forced on their child

image.altText: Hayes and Palombo

props.synopsis: Manipulation of the London Inter-Bank Offered Rate (Libor) and its euro equivalent Euribor occurred in the run-up to and following the 2008 global financial crisis.

title.children: Top UK court quashes ex-bankers' rate rigging convictions

image.altText: John Torode and Gregg Wallace sitting together at a table with a pile of saucepans on either side of them

props.synopsis: Two of the shows hosts were sacked by the broadcaster after a report into the program's internal culture.

title.children: BBC to air MasterChef UK series featuring sacked presenters

image.altText: Kids toys on the floor.

props.synopsis: Fill-in childcare workers won't be included in the first stage of Victoria's new childcare worker registration scheme when it begins next month.

title.children: Worries 'red flags' may go undetected when new childcare scheme begins

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking into a microphone

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump announces a trade deal with Japan that he says will result in Japan investing $US550 billion ($842 billion) into the United States and paying a 15 per cent reciprocal tariff.

title.children: Trump says 'massive' trade deal with Japan has been struck

image.altText: Elisa and Brent

props.synopsis: A Brisbane couple was devastated when prenatal tests showed the baby they had longed for had a serious genetic abnormality. Then their hospital told them it wouldn't perform a termination, leaving them feeling "abandoned".

title.children: Couple expected 'world-class' care at the Mater, but went 'through hell'

image.altText: Sussan Ley sits in the opposition leader's chair in question time.

props.synopsis: By the time the prime minister called an end to Question Time, all those who'd started the proceedings had survived the debut outing for the 48th parliament.

title.children: Question Time had been going for a minute before an MP was in trouble

image.altText: Four women at the rugby union. wearing Australia Wallabies clothing

props.synopsis: With the Tom Richards Cup on the line, the Wallabies will be counting on the golden army turning out in Melbourne, where rugby union carved out its own slice of history 24 years ago.

title.children: Wallabies look for another golden moment in Melbourne against the Lions

image.altText: Close up of singer with long flowy hair, tattoos and holding a microphone

props.synopsis: Performer Ozzy Osbourne's final words sung on a stage were: "I tell you to enjoy life, I wish I could, but it's too late" — a fitting epitaph for a career filled with wild antics, often spurred by drugs and alcohol abuse.

title.children: Ozzy Osbourne went from snorting ants to performing in an armchair

image.altText: Cash in bags

props.synopsis: A Gold Coast couple's defence lawyer says they were trying to hide their wealth from Russian president Vladimir Putin's administration, not the Australian Federal Police.

title.children: Russian couple found with $1.9m cash to stand trial for alleged money laundering

image.altText: A woman with her curly hair tied back walks outside a window

props.synopsis: Lauren Austin admits kissing a teenage girl who was under her supervision and pleads guilty to sexual offences.

title.children: Former coach of Australia's female indoor hockey team admits sexual offences

image.altText: colbert during taping

props.synopsis: John Oliver, Jimmy Fallon, Jon Stewart and Seth Meyers have appeared in the audience during a sketch in the host's first show after news The Late Show was cancelled by CBS.

title.children: Colbert tells Trump the 'gloves are off' as late-night hosts rally amid cancellation

image.altText: A tall fence with razor wire attached at the bottom and top. Blue sky and some jail buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest Aboriginal legal services is calling on the federal government to intervene in what it is calling an incarceration "crisis" in the Northern Territory.

title.children: Federal government urged to intervene in NT incarceration 'crisis'

image.altText: A vibrant 2D illustration featuring an abstract silhouette of a person and many overlapping envelope icons on red background

props.synopsis: How a malicious email barrage led to a hacker community, claims of extortion, and an insight into the dark side of online gambling.

title.children: How an 'email bomb' helped track down a crypto scammer

image.altText: A jet being refuelled in the sky

props.synopsis: The exercise will see more than 400 aircraft and 12,000 personnel from the US, Australia and other countries such as Canada, France and Japan conduct exercises over 50 locations across the Pacific region.

title.children: 'We'll fight and win': US's biggest-ever Pacific exercise 'directed at China'

image.altText: A crowd of men and women, some with Japanese flags.

props.synopsis: The once fringe Sanseito has become the fourth largest opposition party in parliament by pushing a nationalist "Japanese First" agenda.

title.children: Fear of 'silent invasion' by foreigners in Japan spurs far-right popularity

image.altText: Dead stingrays on Kangaroo Island

props.synopsis: South Australia is dealing with an "unprecedented" environmental disaster, which has spread throughout the coastline, killing thousands of sea creatures. And it's unlikely to go away anytime soon.

title.children: What is happening with SA's algal bloom and why should the rest of Australia care?

image.altText: Young woman in the middle of a protest holding up a sign and shouting.

props.synopsis: Ukraine's parliament passed legislation that will tighten oversight of two key anti-corruption agencies, which critics say could further consolidate power within President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's inner circle.

title.children: Thousands protest bill that weakens anti-corruption watchdogs in Ukraine

image.altText: A man with short brown hair wearing a black tshirt is kneeling down and patting a dog.

props.synopsis: Police have seized an Elvis T-shirt, drink bottle and a wristband from Port Lincoln scrubland on Wednesday as their search continues for the missing remains of the alleged murder victim.

title.children: Police seize Elvis T-shirt and other items in Julian Story search

image.altText: Trump speaks at a lectern flanked by men and women in suits or white tracksuits, many with medals around their necks.

props.synopsis: The organisation that runs the US Olympic and Paralympic teams quietly changes its policies around transgender athlete representation.

title.children: Transgender athletes effectively banned from US Olympics team

image.altText: Blue and white Brisbane Watch House sign

props.synopsis: Police say a 41-year-old man "became unresponsive" at the watch house on Saturday, and was pronounced dead at the scene.

title.children: Investigation underway after death at Brisbane watch house

image.altText: An Italian greyhound puppy wearing a loose-fitting jersey-style jacket.

props.synopsis: Whether your dog needs to wear a coat in winter depends on several factors, including its size and breed and how cold it gets where you live.

title.children: How to tell if your dog needs a jacket in winter

image.altText: An unidentifiable person on an e-bike waits to cross a city intersection.

props.synopsis: Calls for police to be given powers to seize and destroy illegal e-bikes receive cheers and applause at a public hearing examining the safety of e-transport devices in Queensland.

title.children: Gold Coast residents cheer calls to 'seize and burn' illegal e-bikes

image.altText: A family stands near a pen of sheep at a saleyard.

props.synopsis: Lamb prices are continuing to reach record highs in Australian saleyards as drought conditions impact supply amid high demand.

title.children: Lamb price record smashed again as drought impacts supply

image.altText: The Netball World Cup trophy stands on a pedestal as a blurred Australian team looks on

props.synopsis: There are significant changes on the horizon for netball's major tournament, with its frequency set to increase beyond 2027 from once every four years to every two years. So what are the pros and cons of the World Cup being held biennially?

title.children: Who benefits from an increase in Netball World Cups?
